title.narrative: Uttarakhand Water Supply Program for Peri Urban Areas

description.narrative: The Program Development Objective (PDO) is to increase access to improved water supply services in peri-urban areas in Uttarakhand. Description: In recent years Uttarakhand has experienced rapid urbanization which has led to the rise of significant peri-urban areas that, while classified as rural, are effectively urban in nature (in terms of density of population, the structure of the economy, and aspirations of the people). Improving water supply services in these peri-urban areas is a priority for the state as it is struggling with rapidly growing population and poor water supply services in these areas. These peri-urban areas of cities, for example Dehradun, Haridwar, Rishikesh, Roorkee, Haldwani, have very low coverage of about 30% to 40% household connections for water spply. This project will incentivize the water supply service improvement program for such rapidly expanding peri-urban areas in Uttarakhand and also show the way for such challenging areas that are increasingly part of the landscape of India and other countries.

participating-org.narrative: Department of Drinking Water and Sanitation, Government of Uttarakhand
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

baseline.value: Existing M&E system is limited in scope and does not cover per-urban areas

target.value: Review implementation of the M&E systems and identify required changes and future needs

actual.value: M&E System is functional, data uploading delayed

title.narrative: Annual report on water services performance in peri-urban areas
Improved policy for water supply program in peri-urban areas

baseline.value: No specific water supply policy for peri-urban areas

target.value: Volumetric tariffs and water connections policies implemented in all targeted peri-urban areas

actual.value: Improved Policy for Peri-Urban Areas adopted
